title: Øvre Bardu Chapel
content: Øvre Bardu Chapel (Norwegian: Øvre Bardu kapell) is a chapel of the Church of Norway in Bardu Municipality in Troms county, Norway. It is located along the Sørdalselva river in the Sørdalen valley in eastern Bardu. It is an annex chapel for the Bardu parish which is part of the Senja prosti (deanery) in the Diocese of Nord-Hålogaland. The white, wooden church was built in a long church style in 1971 using plans drawn up by the architect Petter Bratli. The church seats about 200 people.[1][2][3]
